page.title: 19ON THE RIVER IN PULBOROUGH.
page.content: People use the River Arun in many ways for recreation. The river has tides and a strong current so swimming is dangerous, but people go boating.There are 30 Pulborough and West Chiltington Sea Scouts who meet every Friday night. They practise canoeing, and the Scouts and Guides use the river for the Arun canoe race. Lots of people go fishing in the river. You can catch dace, pike, bream, perch, carp, rudd and gudgeon, but you need a strong line and rod. The best places are in the shade and winter is the best time of year, when it is breezy. You need bread bait for bream and carp, and live maggots for perch, dace roach and gudgeon. You can buy bait and get a licence in the fishing shop near the river. The Pulborough Angling Society has about 200 members.
